solution.text:
\(_{j}_ = _{k}_(p-_{l}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow _{j}_ = _{k}_p - (_{k}_ \times _{l}_)\) [Using Distributive Law]
\(\Rightarrow _{j}_ = _{k}_p - _{{k*l}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{j}_ + _{{k*l}}_ = _{k}_p\) [Taking the constant terms to one side]
\(\Rightarrow _{{j+(k*l)}}_ = _{k}_p\)
Dividing both sides by _{k}_, we get:
\(_{{Fraction(j+(k*l),k)}}_ = p\)
